thread.title: Ethiopia: U.S. Investment Lags in Ethiopia
thread.title_full: Ethiopia: U.S. Investment Lags in Ethiopia

title: Ethiopia: U.S. Investment Lags in Ethiopia
text:
Kenya: Obama's Visit Exposed Our Infrastructure Deficit 
This visit creates an opportunity to review trade relations between the two countries which, despite the African Growth & Opportunity Act (AGOA), has been somewhat underwhelming. 
The export trend has been steadily increasing standing at 207 million dollars in 2014, up from 194 million dollars in 2013 and 128 million dollars back in 2010. While this may be good news to some, the fact that the trade balance is exceedingly in favour of the US leaves many anxious. 
This is not, however, the only problem. In terms of investment, there are only 210 United States companies licensed in Ethiopia - a mere drop in the bucket when compared with countries from Europe or Eastern Asia. According to a 2015 Ethiopia Investment Climate Statement from the US Embassy in Ethiopia, the country is suitable for investments, especially in the manufacturing sector. What this report and the visit from the President will do to change the landscape remains to be seen. More on This
